briefTitle: Effectiveness of Myofascial Release Versus Manual Lymphatic Drainage After Breast Cancer Surgery
officialTitle: Effectiveness of Myofascial Release Versus Manual Lymphatic Drainage After Breast Cancer Surgery In Women Undergoing Conservative Surgery and Radiotherapy. Randomized Clinical Trial
eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Women between the ages of 30 and 60 diagnosed with breast cancer undergoing conservative / partial surgery.
* Without lymphedema or mild lymphedema.
* They must have finished the coadjuvant treatment.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Women with muscle or tendon lesions in the arm.
* Kin disorders or circulatory pathology.
* Chemotherapy or radiotherapy.
* Surgical history in the area are excluded from the study.
